intro: Hoffmannia racemifera, commonly known as the mountain hoffmannia, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features dense clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring, often in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are dark green, leathery, and arranged in whorls around the stems. Hoffmannia racemifera is adapted to cold, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests and alpine regions.
